column2: U.S. Senate unanimously confirms McDonald to head veterans agency WASHINGTON
column3: July 29 The U.S. Senate on Tuesday unanimously confirmed Bob McDonald as the next Veterans Affairs secretary
column4: pinning Washington's hopes on the former Procter & Gamble Co chief executive to launch a massive turnaround effort at the troubled agency.

column2: FDA Oks expanded use of Regeneron's eye drug July 29 Regeneron Pharmaceuticals Inc  said the U.S. Food and Drug Administration has approved the expanded use of its eye drug Eylea for the treatment of diabetic macular edema.

REFILE-Reynolds American profit rises 6.7 pct on higher pricing July 29 Tobacco major Reynolds American Inc's  quarterly profit rose 6.7 percent as price increases helped to make up for a drop in cigarette volumes.
CORRECTED-China brands beat global rivals with tea toothpaste & pickled plums SHANGHAI/HONG KONG
column3: July 29 With green-tea flavoured toothpaste and pickled plum juice
column4: an army of Chinese retailers is tapping local tastes to whittle away market share from global rivals that are banking their future growth on the world's second-largest consumer market.

column2: Murdoch's Fox open to giving Time Warner board seats in new bid: BloombergFCC chairman tells Time Warner to end Dodgers TV dispute LOS ANGELES
column3: July 29 The chairman of the Federal Communications Commission told Time Warner Inc on Tuesday to end its dispute with DirecTV and other cable operators that has left most fans of the Los Angeles Dodgers baseball team unable to watch games on local television.  FCC chairman tells Time Warner to end Dodgers TV dispute LOS ANGELES
column4: July 29 The chairman of the Federal Communications Commission told Time Warner Inc on Tuesday to end its dispute with DirecTV and other cable operators that has left most fans of the Los Angeles Dodgers baseball team unable to watch games on local television. WASHINGTON Rupert Murdochs 21st Century Fox is open to giving Time Warner Inc shareholders seats on the new company's board if its takeover bid succeeds
column5: Bloomberg reported on Saturday
column6: citing people familiar with the situation.FCC chairman tells Time Warner to end Dodgers TV dispute LOS ANGELES
column7: July 29 The chairman of the Federal Communications Commission told Time Warner Inc on Tuesday to end its dispute with DirecTV and other cable operators that has left most fans of the Los Angeles Dodgers baseball team unable to watch games on local television.

column2: Fitch Places Sky's 'BBB+' on Rating Watch Negative; Guides to Potential 2-Notch Downgrade (The following statement was released by the rating agency) LONDON
column3: July 29 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has placed British Sky Broadcasting plc's  (Sky) Long term Issuer Default Rating (IDR) and senior unsecured rating of  'BBB+' on Rating Watch Negative (RWN) following the announcement of Sky's  proposed acquisition of 100% of Sky Italia and a 57.4% stake in Sky Deutschland  from Twenty-First Century Fox.  The most likely outcome of the RWN will be a two-notch downgrade to 'BBB-'
column4: with  its resolutio

column2: CORRECTED-UPDATE 3-Tyson to sell Mexico
column3: Brazil poultry businesses July 28 Tyson Foods Inc said on Monday it would sell its Mexican and Brazilian poultry businesses to JBS SA for $575 million and use the proceeds to pay down debt from its pending $7.7 billion purchase of Hillshire Brands Co.

UPDATE 1-U.S. Senate shortens transport extension
column3: sets up clash with House WASHINGTON
column4: July 29 The U.S. Senate on Tuesday approved an $8.1 billion short-term extension of federal funding for transportation projects through  the end of 2014
column5: setting up a clash with the House of Representatives just days ahead of cutbacks in money for road
column6: bridge and transit construction.
